author: Suresh A
title: Stencil
content: Stencil is a JavaScript tool that enables you to build framework-independent and standards-compliant web components using technologies, such as TypeScript and JSX. Stencil provides APIs that makes writing fast components a breeze. These APIs ‚Äî Virtual DOM, JSX, Async rendering and Reactive data-binding ‚Äî equip developers with superpowers to create custom web components. Popular JavaScript frameworks, including React, Vue and Angular, all have something in common ‚Äì the ability to create custom and reusable components. Check out this StencilJS Guide written by Christian Nwamba for a succinct primer on generating pure custom components.

author: Prost C
title: Ionic Native
content: Ionic Native 5 brings the project to fully framework-agnostic status, as we prepare Ionic Framework for a future where our components work in any popular framework, or without one at all. This also means that Ionic Native 5 is the nail in the coffin for ngCordova, as Ionic Native 5 will work in any situation that ngCordova did for AngularJS, along with having many more maintained plugins.
